summary: Purpose Myeloid differentiation factor 88 (Myd88) plays important roles in immune responses to a plasmid DNA rabies vaccine. pIRES-Rgp protected 80% of mice following intramuscular and intradermal immunizations. pIRES-Rgp protected 80% of the mice following intramuscular and intradermal immunizations. rabies is 100% fatal but preventable by timely administration of effective pre- or post-exposure vaccination. successful immunization of about 70% of susceptible canine population could prevent rabies transmission among canines. canines require annual rabies vaccination from 3 months of age. vaccines employ gene gun, electroporation, cationic lipids and microparticles. delivery approaches employing gene gun, electroporation, cationic lipids and microparticles, and nanopolymers. plasmid vaccination are currently focused on improved vector design. studies have reported critical roles for signaling through TLR and MyD88 pathways in the generation of vaccine-generated humoral immunity [27,29,30] Takeshita et al. reported the enhancement of immunogenicity and protective efficacy of a plasmid-based influenza vaccine, upon the use of Myd88 as a genetic adjuvant. large-scale, endotoxin-free plasmid preparations were made using a commercial kit. pIRES-Rgp encoding the glycoprotein gene of rabies virus has been reported. nal antibody against rabies virus glycoprotein was used in indirect immunofluorescent staining procedure for glycoprotein expression. the secondary antibody conjugates were purchased from Merck Biosciences (Mumbai, India) an in-house anti-rabies serum was employed as a reference serum in the rapid fluorescent focus inhibition test (RFFIT) construction of pIRES-Rgp The full-length glycoprotein gene (G) was PCR amplified from pBacPak-GRC9 vector using primers GFor and GRev bearing NheI and MluI sites. the construct was named pIRES-Rgp. the amplicon was gel-purified using GenElute gel extraction kit (Sigma Aldrich) the digests were again gel-purified, and a ligation reaction was set up with a vector:insert ratio of 1:3 using T4 DNA ligase. after overnight incubation at 16°C, 10 L of the reaction mixture was used to transform competent Escherichia coli DH5 cells by a standard heat-shock procedure. the cells were acetone-fixed and subjected to indirect immunofluorescent staining for each protein. the cells were probed with a rabbit anti-MyD88 polyclonal antibody. the coverslips were examined under an inverted fluorescence microscope. plasmid preparations were stored in aliquots at -20°C till further use. ninety micrograms of each plasmid, contained in 100 L or 50 L of sterile normal saline, was inoculated intramuscularly or intradermally into each animal. the animals showed symptoms of rabies were euthanized and infection confirmed by direct fluorescent antibody testing on impression smears prepared from extracted brains. p0.05 were considered statistically significant. plasmid preparations were made using a commercial kit (EndoFree Plasmid Purification Giga Kit, Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) the restricton enzymes NheI (Cat. No. R0131), MluI (Cat. No. R0198S), XbaI (Cat. No. R0145S), and SalI (Cat. No. R0138S) and Quick-Load 1 kb DNA ladder (Cat. a polyclonal rabbit MyD88 antibody was purchased from Merck Biosciences (Mumbai, India) an in-house anti-rabies serum was employed as a reference serum in the rapid fluorescent focus inhibition test (RFFIT) rabies virus and rabies vaccine A standard laboratory 'fixed' strain of rabies virus was employed in the in vitro and animal experiments. the full-length glycoprotein gene (G) was PCR amplified from pBacPak-GRC9 vector using primers GFor and GRev. the construct was named pIRES-Rgp. restriction digestion of pIRES vector and the amplicon was performed with XbaI and SalI enzymes. a ligation reaction was set up with a vector:insert ratio of 1:3. after overnight incubation at 16°C, 10 L of the reaction mixture was used to transform competent Escherichia coli DH5 cells by a standard heat-shock procedure. the identities of the recombinants were verified by restriction enzyme analysis and by the reaction was set up in a volume of 50 L using mydFor and MydRev primers. the reaction was set up in a volume of 50 L using pFLAG-CMV4-hMyd88 as template. the amplicon was gel-purified using GenElute gel extraction kit. expression of genes encoded in pIRES-Rgp and pIRES-Rgp-Myd was evaluated by indirect immunofluorescent staining of cells transiently transfected with each. expression of glycoprotein and Myd88 genes from pIRES-Rgp has been reported earlier [8] the starter culture was inoculated into 5 mL of fresh LB ampicillin broth. the bacteria were pelleted by centrifugation at 5,000 rpm at 4°C. the plasmid identity was once again verified by restriction enzyme analysis. estimation of rabies virus neutralizing antibody titre by RFFIT Blood samples were collected from the immunized mice by retro-orbital venous plexus puncture. the samples were allowed to clot, and sera were separated by centrifugation at 6,000 rpm for 5 minutes. sera were heat-inactivated in a water bath at 56°C for 30 minutes, and stored at -20°C till tested. the mice were subjected to an intracerebral challenge with 50 LD50 of CVS-11 strain of rabies virus, on day 35. at the end of the observation period, the percent survival in each group was recorded. the animals showing symptoms of rabies were euthanized, and infection confirmed by direct fluorescent antibody testing. pIRES-Rgp-Myd cells transfected with pIRES-Rgp-Myd showed typical apple-green, membrane and cytoplasmic fluorescence. orange-red TRITC fluorescence, indicating MyD88 expression, was observed on the cell membranes and in the cytoplasm, in the same fields. pIRES-Rgp-Myd induced 3.2 fold higher levels of antibodies than pIRES-Rgp. pIRES-Rgp-Myd induced 3.2 fold higher levels of antibodies than pIRES-Rgp. on day 28, the highest titres of neutralizing antibodies were still seen in the Rabipur group (14.4 IU/mL) the mean titre observed in groups immunized with pIRES-Rgp-Myd was 3.6 IU/mL. the RVNA titres increased >3-fold in these groups, following the booster dose on day 21. pIRES-Rgp protected 100% of the animals following intramuscular and intradermal immunization. pIRES-Rgp, however, protected only 80% of the mice following immunization via either route. all the animals immunized with Rabipur survived the challenge. construction of pIRES-Rgp The Myd88 fragment (891 bp) was successfully amplified by PCR. pIRES-Rgp-Myd was cloned into the MCS-B of pIRES-Rgp. the transfected cells showed typical apple-green, membrane and cytoplasmic fluorescence, indicative of glycoprotein expression. orange-red TRITC fluorescence, indicating MyD88 expression, was observed on the cell membranes and in the cytoplasm, in the same fields. pIRES-Rgp-Myd transfected cells showed typical apple-green, membrane and cytoplasmic fluorescence. orange-red TRITC fluorescence, indicating MyD88 expression, was observed on the cell membranes and in the cytoplasm, in the same fields. the results from a single representative experiment are summarized in Table 1. the RVNA titres were below the limit of detection by rapid fluorescent focus inhibition test in these groups. pIRES-Rgp-Myd induced 3.2 fold higher levels of antibodies than pIRES-Rgp. pIRES-Rgp-Myd and pIRES-Rgp induced titres of 3.0 and 0.96 IU/mL respectively, at this time point. pIRES-Rgp-Myd induced titres of 3.0 and 0.96 IU/mL respectively, at this time point. the results from a single representative experiment are summarized in Table 1. the RVNA titres were below the limit of detection by rapid fluorescent focus inhibition test in these groups. the results were presented as meanstandard deviation. the highest RVNA titres at day 14 were detected in the group immunized with Rabipur (8 IU/mL) pIRES-Rgp-Myd and pIRES-Rgp induced titres of 3.0 and 0.96 IU/mL respectively, at this time point. results show data compiled from challenge study in the intramuscular. despite successful demonstrations of efficacy of plasmid DNA-based vaccination strategy for rabies, the technology is still constrained by poor immunogenicity observed in larger animals. a number of physical, chemical and biological methods have been developed and evaluated for enhancing DNA vaccine efficacy. in vivo electroporation and gene gun delivery have been found to yield the highest efficacy. pIRES-Rgp-Myd increased the RVNA titres > 2-fold upon intradermal immunization, compared to pIRES-Rgp (p0.05). we observed comparable antibody titres in groups receiving pIRES-Rgp intramuscularly and intradermally. pIRES-Rgp protected 80% of the immunized animals against the challenge. 100% of the animals immunized with pIRES-Rgp survived the challenge. findings from the present study seem to support this.
